Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory19.jpg
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiRainNew.prefab
Early summer always brings this kind of downpour—light yet relentless.
In the humid, stifling air, the temperature continues to rise as those sheltering beneath the eaves find their patience ebbing away with each falling raindrop.

—Someone suggested replacing simulation training with field exercises, so special authorization for surface deployment allowed this batch of recruits to train in actual ground-level combat conditions.
But everyone seems to have overlooked one crucial detail—that early summer here is the season of endless rain.

The rain severely hampers all training activities, with some training equipment even at risk of rusting. With nothing else to do, everyone can only huddle under the eaves and pray for the weather to clear up.
Just as another large bead of sweat hits the ground, a calm voice cuts through the air, perfectly timed before the complaints can erupt.
Wanshi
The weather isn't looking great. Let's call the training off.
Having been enduring the heat, the students burst into cheers as if pardoned from some sort of torture.
Wanshi
As for tomorrow... ah right, vacation starts tomorrow. We'll continue the remaining lessons when we're back.
Wanshi
That's it. Dismissed.
Excited Trainees
Hooray!!
Clearly, Wanshi is not what you'd call a strict instructor.
The trainees scatter in every direction the moment they're dismissed. Without the energetic youngsters to fill up the space, the training ground cooled down right away.
All that remains is the gentle echo of raindrops against the roof.
As Wanshi turns to pack up the equipment under the eaves, he naturally strikes up a conversation with you.
Wanshi
Heading back to the base, too? Need me to take you there?
You know how to drive a transport vehicle?
Sure, thank you.
Wanshi
Of course. Someone taught me how.
Wanshi
Yawn... Don't mention it.
Watching the white Construct let out one yawn after another, you can't help but feel worried.
How about we rest a bit before heading out? Are you sure you're up for this?
Driving while tired is a bad idea.
Wanshi lets out another soft yawn.
Wanshi
No problem. Pretty sure I'm not just gonna fall asleep with you sitting next to me...
But that's exactly what's about to happen now!
Wanshi lifts his heavy eyelids to look at you and does a lazy stretch.
Want to chat?
Alright, let's talk about that wolf fang pillow Kamui got you the other day.
Wanshi
...Hmm, sure.
Wanshi
...Mm, never mind, let's not get into that.
So... what are you planning to do after this training mission?
Wanshi
Hmm... I think I'll find a quiet spot to curl up in, but I'm sure they'll have more missions for me soon enough.
Wanshi
What about you?
I'd love to find a peaceful spot in nature where I could just rest and unwind.
But I know that's not gonna happen now.
Probably will have to wait until I retire from service.
Wanshi gives a slight nod, as though in agreement with what you just said.
Wanshi
It would have been possible without the Punishing, no?
Wanshi gazes over with drowsy eyes, making it impossible to tell whether he's being serious or just blabbering.
Wanshi
Say, life here doesn't ever really change...
Wanshi
Don't you find it a little boring?
(Shake head.)
(Nod.)
Wanshi
Yeah? I look forward to a life like that, too.
Wanshi
Really? I'm actually looking forward to that kind of life.
Wanshi
It's so peaceful that... I can see right through the end of my life, and I quite like how stable it is.
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiRainNew.prefab
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory46.jpg
That casual chat with Wanshi passes like the rain that day—nothing more than a brief interlude.
After returning to Babylonia, you quickly dive back into your busy schedule.
In the blink of an eye, the joint training session on the ground draws to a close, marking the end of the mission.
Just as you arrive at the meeting room with training reports, the door flies open before you can even knock. Behind a startled-looking Kamui stand two other Strike Hawk members.
Kamui
Whooooah! Commandant?!
Chrome
Commandant...? Do you have a report to submit, too?
Camu
Looks like this guy's been having it rough lately, too.
It's all right. A break is coming up soon anyway.
You scan the three Constructs but don't see the usual, listless white Construct among them.
Where's Wanshi? Didn't he come with you?
Is Wanshi still sleeping?
Kamui
Looking for Wanshi? He's out on a mission and hasn't come back yet.
Chrome
Yeah... It's been so long, yet we've only received a few video feeds lately. I wonder what's keeping him so busy.
This response brings to mind a recent conversation you've had with Wanshi.
So they did assign him a new mission, huh...
Looks like he still won't get a chance to take a proper break...
Kamui
Oh right! I have the video he sent back yesterday. Here, let me show you.
Before you can even react, Kamui has already turned on his terminal's holographic playback interface.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory726.jpg
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryMovieFilm.prefab
The footage is crystal clear, showing the faded outlines of old Kowloong architecture.
Wanshi has his back to the screen, surrounded by a group of playful children. Even through the screen, their enthusiasm for him is palpable.
He's still as popular as ever with the kids.
A moment later, Wanshi glances sideways at the camera, lets out a half-hearted yawn, and reaches out his hand.
Wanshi
Alright... That should be enough time for the report...
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiNoiseNew.prefab
Click—
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiNoiseNew.prefab
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryMovieFilm.prefab
Video playback ends.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory46.jpg
Kamui
This is all we got... It's just a quick check-in to let us know he's alive! He wouldn't even show us his face properly.
Camu
Tch, what's with all this secrecy, even with us?
Chrome
Commandant, are you looking for Wanshi?
Yeah, but it's nothing important.
I was just thinking... it'd be nice if we could find a way to get him to take a proper break.
Chrome puts up a tired smile.
Chrome
Come to think of it, I don't think he's actually ever relaxed since that time I rejected his request for a "hibernation leave".
Chrome
So, when he's back from this mission, I think I'm gonna...
Celica
There, found it.
The crisp sound of footsteps echoes as Celica walks in, carrying a stack of battle reports.
Celica
There you are, 【kuroname】.
Seeing Celica make a beeline for her target, you let out a sigh.
Guess I'm in no position to mourn people's pain...
Celica
Don't worry! Yes, I'm here with another mission for you, but this one's gonna be a breeze—think of it as a recuperating vacation!
A recuperating vacation?
Did you just say it's gonna be a breeze?
Celica
You don't trust me...? Does it seem like I'm lying to you?
Kamui
Don't ever put "mission" and "vacation" in the same sentence. That's how sacred a vacation is!
Camu
Might as well just work if we've got to work anyway while we're on vacation.
Celica
Ahem, just take a look at the mission brief! You'll see what I mean—it's the real deal this time. Satisfaction guaranteed!
With all the eyes looking at you curiously, you've got no choice but to reluctantly browse through the mission brief Celica handed over.
Mission Objective: Support Science Council members in their advance to Earth to collect plant samples from a pristine forest.
Mission Difficulty: Very Easy.
Mission Duration: One week to several months.
The mission schedule is quite flexible...
Kamui
The mission brief makes the mission itself seem easy enough.
The mission location... is in Kowloong?
In the bottom right corner of the mission brief where you are pointing, there is, written in tiny text, the name of an area no one has ever mentioned before.
—Mission Location: Conservation area near the outskirts of Kowloong, within the bounds of Nanyun Old Town.
